byline.contributor: Alan Blinder, Frances Robles and Benjamin Mueller contributed reporting. Susan Beachy and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

abstract: Police Officer Clarence W Habersham Jr is facing criticism for role he played in fatal shooting of Walter L Scott in North Charleston, SC, as he was first officer on scene in wake of shooting by Officer Michael T Slager; fact that Habersham is black complicates typical racial dynamics in high-profile police shootings, and offers window into challenges that black officers face in predominantly white police departments.
lead_paragraph: Officer Clarence W. Habersham Jr., who responded to the scene of the police killing of Walter L. Scott in North Charleston, S.C., was criticized by some who said he had not done enough to help Mr. Scott.

headline.main: After Walter Scott Shooting, Scrutiny Turns to 2nd Officer
headline.print_headline: After Shooting, Scrutiny Turns to 2nd Officer

snippet: Officer Clarence W. Habersham Jr., who responded to the scene of the police killing of Walter L. Scott in North Charleston, S.C., was criticized by some who said he had not done enough to help Mr. Scott.
